name: affine line with double origin to affine line

proofs.separated: Write $X$ for the affine line with double origin. Let $f : \AA^1_\QQ \to X \times_{\AA^1_\QQ} X$ be the morphism induced from the two different inclusions $\AA^1_\QQ \to X$. Then $f^{-1}(\Delta_{X/\AA^1_\QQ}(X)) = \AA^1_\QQ \setminus \{ 0 \}$ is not closed, so the diagonal is not closed.
proofs.semi-separated: Write $X$ for the affine line with double origin. Then $\Delta_{X/\AA^1_\QQ}$ is affine as $X \times_{\AA^1_\QQ} X$ can be covered by affines (four affine lines) whose pre-images are all affine.

description: The projection of the affine line with double origin over the rational numbers to the affine line.
